results.title: Motivating the class
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
Portrays a student-teacher trying to interest a class in the subject of mathematics. His mistakes and achievements are shown with explanatory comments by his supervisory teacher. The students are first taught in an abstract fashion, without relating the subject to the interests of the student. Later, mathematics are applied to subjects of student interest, student participation is encouraged, outdoor projects are undertaken leading to more effective teaching.

results.title: Individual differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
The case study of a shy, slow child, who is different from his classmates and from his older, socially-adept brother, whose reputation is a constant reminder of his own shortcomings. Everyone needs to succeed, the film points out, and most of all those in terms of individual interests and capabilities. It is the job of the school to shape education to these individual needs.

results.title: Importance of goals
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
Follows the case of a 13 year-old boy to illustrate the principle that all education is essentially a process of attaining basic, meaningful goals. In the class-room, the child is bored. Outside, a series of incidents are used to show that the child shows interest where a tangible goal provides the necessary incentive to make him want to learn. Something to work toward, in terms of young minds and young desires, can spell the difference between eager, interested students, and those for whom school is both boring and dull.

results.title: Prenatal care
results.creator_credit: C Larrance, D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
Through the prenatal care of three women in different stages of pregnancy, explains the need for medical examination and care, discusses correct diet, exercises for daily use, proper clothing, and a healthy attitude of mind.

results.title: Postnatal care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
Shows the mother in her hospital room, doing exercises, caring for her baby, nursing etc. It discusses the father’s relation to the new situation and portrays some of the joy to be found in the new family constellation. Diagrams show how the mother’s body returns to normal.

results.title: A Normal birth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A photographic record of an actual delivery depicting the normal processes of childbirth and the two final stages of labour. The preparation of the mother in the delivery room, the actual birth of the child, and the immediate post-birth care of both mother and child are shown.

results.title: Labor and childbirth
results.creator_credit: D.M. Hatfield and Photo & Sound Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A young couple expects their first child. Shows onset of labor, the trip to the hospital, call to doctor, admission to maternity ward, routine preparations for delivery, including instructions to mother, and normal birth of child. Stresses the assumption that fear stems from lack of knowledge.

results.title: Edge of the Cold
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
group_works.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC

results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES
